get_bg_related_kegg

Source: R/net.R
get_bg_related_kegg.Rd

This function will select all genes in all kegg pathways which are directly connected with the genes in gene_list

get_bg_related_kegg(gene_list, PFPRefnet, rm_duplicated = FALSE)

Arguments

gene_list,

a vector of characters, refers to genes ids
PFPRefnet,

an object of PFPRefnet class, it contains all kegg pathways.
rm_duplicated,

a logical, whether to remove the duplicated kegg edges in different pathways. Defalut is FALSE

Details

, It will return a data.frame which can be translated a graph or network. In the data.frame, source refers to the genes in gene_list, target refers to the directly connected genes in kegg, weight is 0.5, no real means, pathway refers to the pathway which the edge emerge and edge_type is "kegg".

Note, if rm_duplicated is FALSE, it may return many duplicated edges, which will be complex when plotting a network. If rm_duplicated is TRUE, it will retain the first pathway which contains the duplicated edge.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
data(PFPRefnet_hsa)
data(gene_list)
edges_kegg <- get_bg_related_kegg(gene_list,PFPRefnet_hsa)
}
